result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayne M Kennon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is requested at $8,333.04.  A restitution hearing is to be scheduled.
AMENDED 10-14-2015:  Court determines that the requested restitution be determined through the divorce proceedings.  Court orders the defendant to pay $1,000 deductible to Kathleen K. (as ordered restitution).  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.

Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AMENDED 10-14-2015:  Cash bail applied.  ALL COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with Watertown School District except for school functions as it relates to the children.
No VIOLENT contact with wife.

supervisions.notes: Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AMENDED 10-14-2015:  Cash bail applied.  ALL COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Same conditions for probation apply as to Count 1.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Notices of Hearing
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kayne M Kennon in court with attorney Robert J. Penegor.  
Restitution being requested is $8,333.40

Atty. Penegor presented arguments to the court (restitution involves marital property and defense is requesting defendant only be responsible for 1/2 due to the marital property law - divorce is currently pending).
State presented arguments to the court.

Court orders the following:
Court finds this should be debt to be determined through the divorce proceedings.
Court orders the defendant pay the $1,000 deductable to Ms. Kennon as ordered restitution - Apply Bail.
All costs/surcharges/fines are to be paid out of the bail on file.
Any balance left can be returned to the posting party.
Amended JOC to be prepared.
copy of letter to Allied Insurance filed by State regarding restitution hearing set on October 14, 2015.
Restitution hearing at 10-14-2015 02:30 pm  **no paper copy in physical file**
Treatment Letter, received and filed in court.
Received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kayne M Kennon in court with attorney Robert J. Penegor.

State moves to amend to 3 misdemeanors.
State filed an amended information.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 1, 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 1, 2 & 3.
Victim presented statements to the court.
Defendant's sister presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
WITHHELD SENTENCE.
2 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  1.5 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Watertown School District except for school functions as it relates to the children.
No Violent Contact with:  Wife and only with her approval.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Restitution Requested:  $8,333.04 - Defense requests a Restitution Hearing be Scheduled.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Bail to be held pending restitution hearing.






Count 2:
WITHHELD SENTENCE.
2 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  1.5 Years.

Same as count 1.

 2 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
